timeline.message:
Simplify PR.Close() logic

From earlier discussions on memory management, we should isolate the
concerns of the NSPR layer from having to deal with SSL FD specific
stuff as much as possible. Move what used to be in the SSLFD-specific
NSPR close layer to SSLEngine itself.

Signed-off-by: Alexander Scheel <ascheel@redhat.com>

timeline.bodyText:
This probably can be simplified into:
return Close(fd, false);
timeline.author: edewata

timeline.bodyText: The PR class still has a reference on SSLFDProxy. I think ideally NSPR classes should not deal with SSL.
timeline.author: edewata

replies.bodyText: I think that's fine -- its a simplification over Close(PRFDProxy, boolean) -- otherwise, callers would have to know that SSLFDProxy has to be closed via Close(fd, false) and keep that in mind at every call site.
replies.author: cipherboy

replies.bodyText: If this is a purely object-oriented design, such details should have been handled in PRFDProxy.close() and SSLFDProxy.close(), but let's not worry about this internal API.
replies.author: edewata
